column1: McAllister, happily unaware of who made up the party, watched these inhabitants of the world in which she had lived since she was eight years old stare and chatter as they made their way through the doorway, Mr Sands bowing and scraping at them as befitted a poor relation to whom they were doing a favour, the rest of the bazaar's patrons staring at these strange beings, male and female, as though they were visitors from another planet, perhaps one described by Mr H. G. Wells.
